clinical_study.brief_title: Hepatitis C Elimination in the Netherlands
clinical_study.official_title: Hepatitis C Elimination in the Netherlands (CELINE) - A National Multicenter Cohort Study Retrieving Lost to Follow-up Chronic Hepatitis C Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of CELINE is to retrieve and re-evaluate lost to follow-up chronic hepatitis C patients in the Netherlands.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of lost to follow-up (LTFU) patients successfully re-linked to care
primary_outcome.time_frame: End of study, on average 2.5 years after initiation

secondary_outcome.measure: Total number of LTFU patients in the investigated time period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of study, on average 2.5 years after initiation
secondary_outcome.description: Established contact (via telephone or in writing) with a patient who is eligible for retrieval

secondary_outcome.measure: Awareness of HCV diagnosis among LTFU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of study, on average 2.5 years after initiation
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients who were aware of their HCV diagnosis when they are invited for re-evaluation

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who never had an outpatient appointment with a hepatologist or infectious disease specialist after initial positive HCV test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of study, on average 2.5 years after initiation

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of viraemic patients at time of re-evaluation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of study, on average 2.5 years after initiation

secondary_outcome.measure: Liver fibrosis stage of retrieved patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of study, on average 2.5 years after initiation
End of study, on average 2.5 years after initiation
End of study, on average 2.5 years after initiation
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as years since last (HCV-)related hospital visit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of study, on average 2.5 years after initiation
End of study, on average 2.5 years after initiation
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the absence of HCV RNA at least 12 weeks after treatment

study_pop.textblock: Lost to follow-up (possibly) chronically HCV-infected patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ever diagnosed with (possible) chronic HCV in the 15-year period prior to initiation of the study, defined as having had a positive anti-HCV or HCV RNA test
- Lost to follow-up, defined as the lack of a scheduled outpatient care appointment after the last known positive HCV test result
Exclusion Criteria:
- Younger than 18
- Deceased
- Not residing in the Netherlands
- Unknown current address
- Severe comorbidity or short life expectancy that limits patients from benefiting from retrieval
